ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This is a business themed course, but it's really more of a news/current events and formal Chinese class.

My Chinese level was significantly improved by taking this class - I would recommend it for anyone thinking about doing business in China. I was challenged and really got the support I needed to improve - the assignments were reasonable but also exactly what I needed to advance.
I learned about Chinese vocabulary and phrases from news articles and readings.
By taking this course, I developed a lot of knowledge on China's current economic and political status, some vocabulary specific to doing business in China (the stock market, etc)
I learned about the most successful Chinese companies and the risks of international expansion for them.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I would've liked more speaking/listening beyond the many presentations. With a lot of higher-level chinese courses, the emphasis becomes more and more reading and writing, and that's helpful for a lot of the heritage speakers, but this course was maybe 50/50 heritage and non-heritage.
The class was excellent. The only improvement might be to upload documents earlier to allow students to get ahead and manage their schedules when needed.
This course is well-organized and interactive. I've enjoyed the readings and discussions in class.

Strengths: it is a very hands-on class with many presentations, which makes involvement and implication very high in the class. I liked how it mixed very academic topics with the use of the book, and also some more contemporary topics with the advanced documents we were provided 

Weaknesses: nothing.
This was an amazing course. I cant think of any weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class to anyone looking to really improve their Chinese - especially their speaking and listening ability. Very useful for real-world scenarios.
Take this course if you're interested in reading business-related materials in Chinese and discussing your takeaways and opinions.

Yes, any student that has some basic knowledge in Chinese and wants to improve it in terms of more specific vocabulary should definitely take the class. I believe the added value of this class is not only the academic part but also the small format of it that makes everyone want to participate
Yes!!! Professor Chen is so kind and helpful.
